title: Citi Argentina Keeps Growing with New Branches
summary: Buenos Aires, Argentina – Citi opened four new branches in Argentina: two in the provinces of Mendoza and Tucuman; and two in Buenos Aires, in Escobar and Canning. By the end of 2011, the company will have 74 locations within its distribution network, comprising 69 branches and five points of service centers.
tag-1: Citi Argentina Keeps Growing with New Branches
tag-3: Buenos Aires, Argentina – Citi opened four new branches in Argentina: two in the provinces of Mendoza and Tucuman; and two in Buenos Aires, in Escobar and Canning. By the end of 2011, the company will have 74 locations within its distribution network, comprising 69 branches and five points of service centers.
tag-4: In addition, Citi also opened four new points of service: three in Buenos Aires – adding to the existing downtown center that opened in 2010 – and another in Mar del Plata. These centers allow customers to perform different banking transactions in a convenient way, without the need to visit a branch.
tag-5: "Both at our branches and points-of-service centers, we aim to set a new model of customer experience in banking transactions," said Ignacio Morello, Sales and Distribution head, Citi Argentina. "It is essential for Citi to keep growing and be close to its customers. This is why we are constantly looking for flexible and innovative ways to provide an excellent service."
tag-6: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
